result.execSummary:
The defendant James T Ignaszak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any sentence. Release for work, inmate work assignments, the Day Reporting Center.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the  DNA surcharge during the course of probation to the probation agent.  Any remaining balance due at the end of probation wil become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both.

Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.

No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid presription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
No possession of  more than one cell phone at any one time.
May not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
For the reasons placed on the record, the Court granted the defense request for expungement, if defendant successfully completes the sentence without any violations of probation.

Participate in Cognitive Behavior program or cognitive intervention program.
Fine set at zero.
Participte in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James T Ignaszak

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Martin K. 

AS TO COUNT 1 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; release for work, inmate work assignments, The Day Reporting Center; credit for 0 days. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 24 MONTHS with the following conditions:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to you name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both. 
- Defendant to participate in a Cognitive Behavior program or cognitive intervention program.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

For the reasons placed on the record, the Court GRANTED  the Defense request for expungement, if defendant successfully completes the sentence without any  violations of probation. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;

Defendant James T Ignaszak in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
AS TO COUNT 1 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Defendant James T Ignaszak in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Paul M. Hauer on behalf of Karyle P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
 Court orders case for adjourned Plea and Sentencing, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James T Ignaszak in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription, Oral No Weapons Order,  DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (5/11/15). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-21-2015 at 01:30 pm.

  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.
